flawed_nl_solution:
12 mph faster than 60mph is 60+12=<<60+12=69>>69 mph.
18 mph slower than 60 mph is 60-18=<<60-18=42>>42 mph.
If he spends 1/3 of the time at each of these three speeds, then he averages (60+69+42)/3 = <<(60+69+42)/3=57.0>>57.0 mph.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 72, not 69. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
